title: As a BOC User I want to create a new Request
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the "Requests" widget BOC Users see a "Create New" button.
* Clicking "Create New" will open a pop up where the user can select an ebis player to create a new Request for. 
* The dropdown of players should be all current MLB Players (currently affiliated with an Org - do not include Released or FA players). 
* Selecting a player will populate the POS, MLB Org and DOB fields on the pop up. 
* The BOC user should be able to select which Winter League Club to create the request for. 
* The "Submit to BOC" button should be available after a player and Winter League Club have been selected.
* Clicking "Add Row" should add an additional row to the Request form for the user to be able to submit multiple requests for the same Club at once. 
* If more than one row exists, there is a trash can icon associated with each row. 
* Clicking the trash can icon will remove the relevant row.
* Clicking "Submit to BOC" should submit the request to the BOC and throw a blue success notification per the wireframe.
* The Request should appear in the Winter League Clubs' list of Requests, as well as the BOC's List of requests as "Pending".

title: As a BOC user I want to see a list of the current season's Requests
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Requests+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Within the "Winter Leagues" dashboard there is a "Requests" tab. 
* Clicking on the "Requests" tab will load the Requests widget per the provided Data Discovery.
* The Requests will be sorted in reverse chronological order based on Request Date.  
*Filters and action buttons are covered in follow up stories*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to filter the Winter League Requests
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "Requests" page has filters to enable the user to filter by Season or Status.
* The "season" filter defaults to the current season. Only prior years are available. Changing the dropdown will refresh the widget to display the selected years' requests. 
* The second filter is a status filter. 
* The available statuses are : 
  - All 
  - Pending
  - Submitted
  - In Negotiation
  - Contracted
  - Denied
  - Cancelled
  - Expired
* The default is "All", but clicking one of the other statuses should reload the page to display only the requests that have the selected status.

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to move a Request to the Contracted status
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Winter League Request: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Request+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "In Negotiation". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Contracted". 
* Selecting "Contracted" will update the Request's status to "Contracted" and a blue notification is thrown "Status updated"
* This state change should set the "Agreement Reached" flag on the Winter League Request form associated with this request.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the number of days a request has been in a submitted state
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Request Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Acceptance Criteria: 
* For Requests that have a "Submitted" status the, "Days Remaining" column should be populated for the BOC with a count of the number of days since the Request was moved to the Submitted status. (In other words, the day the request is Submitted this should read 1, the day after it should read 2, etc.).

title: As a BOC User I want to see the state changes to Denied or Granted reflected in the Requests page
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Winter League Request: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Request+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Request is moved to "Denied" by the MLB Club, the status change is reflected in the BOC Requests page. 
* When a Winter League Request is moved to "Granted" by the MLB Club, the request's status moves to In Negotiation in the BOC Requests page.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the number of days remaining until a request expires
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Request Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Acceptance Criteria: 
* For Requests that are in the "In Negotiation" status the, "Days Remaining" column should be populated for the BOC with a countdown from 11 of the number of days since the Request was moved to the In Negotiation status. (In other words, the day the request was granted should read 11, the day after it should read 10, etc.).

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to add comments to a Request with a status of Contracted
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a comments icon next to requests with a status of "Contracted". 
* If no comments have been previously stored, clicking the comments bubble icon will open the pop up displayed in the wireframe to allow for the user to enter a date and any desired comments. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will cancel the edit of the comments and date. 
* Clicking "Save" will store the changes made to the comments and date. 
* If comments or signing date have been previously stored, the comments bubble appears darker to indicate that something has been saved. 
* Clicking on the comments bubble icon for requests that have already had a date and/or comments entered will open the same popup to allow them to view/edit comments.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Submit a Winter League Request
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Winter League Request: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Request+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "Pending". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Submit". 
* Selecting "Submit" will update the Request's status to "Submitted" and trigger a blue notification "Request submitted"
* This state change is what triggers the auto-creation and submission to Club of a Winter League Request for the relevant player. 
* The Winter League Request should appear on the relevant Org's Action Items. 
* The Winter League Request should be able to be completed as normal in ebis by the Org.

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to Cancel a Request
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "Pending", and "Submitted". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Cancel". 
* Selecting "Cancel" will update the Request's status to "Canceled".
* If the BOC user is cancelling a Submitted request, then ebis needs to delete the associated Winter League Request.

title: As BOC I want the action button to read Create Request on the new request modal
custom_steps:
AC:
* Change the button text from "Submit Request" to "Create Request" on the BOC New Request modal.

title: As a BOC user I want to be prevented from creating a Request for a player that has another Request currently in the In Negotiation status
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=errors_displayed_in_row  (general wireframe for displaying tables errors in a row)

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user clicks "Submit Request" on the Create New Request modal, the system will check to see if any of the players included in the request have another Winter League Request in the "In Negotiation" status. 
* If a player is found to already have a request in that status, the system will display an error message in-line with the offending request(s) (see mockup). See Messages #2. 
* The error column will appear between the trashcan and player name
* None of the requests will be processed until each submitted request can pass all rule checks. 
* The user should have the opportunity to remove the offending request(s) and resubmit.

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to move an Expired Request to the Contracted status
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "Expired". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Contracted". 
* Selecting "Contracted" will update the Request's status to "Contracted".
* This state change should set the "Agreement Reached" flag on the Winter League Request form associated with this request.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to automatically create Winter League Requests for all of the Import players
custom_steps:
Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Create+Winter+League+Requests+for+Imports+Batch

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Create Winter League Requests for Imports" is a batch option under the "International" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "Create Winter League Requests for Imports" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters and the provided rules. 
* Any Request created as a result of this batch running should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Player, League, Club, MLB Org.  
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to Cancel an In Negotiation Request
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to requests with a status of "In Negotiation". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Cancel" in addition to "Contracted". 
* Selecting "Cancel" will update the Request's status to "Canceled".
* If the BOC user is cancelling an In Negotiation request, the associated request in ebis should NOT be updated or deleted, unlike when a Submitted request is canceled.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the comments entered by a Major League Club when they grant or deny a winter league request
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The current column that contains the Contracted comments should be renamed to "Contract Info". Otherwise this column and the associated contracted comments should work as they do now.
* There is a new column added to the BOC Request screen "MLB Club Comments".
* This column is populated with any comments entered in the "Comments" section of the Winter League Request transaction form.

title: BOC Request List permissions
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Wiki page: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS+2+Roles+to+LDAP+Mapping+and+creating+new+permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Request List viewer role.
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Request List editor role. 
* Users without either LDAP do not see the "Requests" tab on the Winter League dashboard. 
* The LDAPs are added to the wiki. 
* If a user does not have any of the Reserve List or Request permissions, they do not see Winter Leagues dashboard at all.

title: As a user I want to see different colors for winter league request statuses
custom_steps:
AC:
Red: Denied, Cancelled, Expired
Green:Submitted, Contracted
Black: Pending, In Negotiation

title: As a BOC user I want moving a Request to Contracted to cancel all of the player's other outstanding requests
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user moves an "In Negotiation" or "Expired" request to "Contracted", all of the other requests for the player for any club that are in a "Pending", or "Submitted" status are moved to "Cancelled".

title: As a BOC user I want a request to be automatically expired if the number of days on an In Negotiation request reaches 0
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_boc

Request Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Acceptance Criteria: 
* For Requests that are in an "In Negotiation" status, at the end of the 11th day they should be automatically moved to "Expired" by the system.

title: As a BOC user I want to be prevented from creating a Request for a Winter League Club that has 10 currently Pending requests
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user clicks "Submit Request" on the Create New Request modal, the system will check to see how many non-Import player winter league requests the Submitting team currently has Pending. 
* "Pending" for the purposes of this count should include all requests in the "Pending", "Submitted" and "In Negotiation" statuses. 
* If the submission of the request(s) will put the Team over the 10 limit, then all the new requests are bounced back with the in-line error message that the Club has exceeded the allowed amount of pending requests. See Messages #1. 
* None of the requests will be processed until each submitted request can pass all rule checks. 
* The user should have the opportunity to remove the offending request(s) and resubmit.

title: As a Major League Club user I want to see a notification when a player of mine is Contracted with a Winter League Club
custom_steps:
Clipboard:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLR+-+Clipboard

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a Winter League Request is moved to the Contracted status, the "Agreement Reached" checkbox is currently checked off.
* A notification should also be generated for the MLB Org that Granted the request at the time the Date Signed and Contracted comments are entered with the date and text of the Contracted Comments. See Clipboard #5
* The Player Name should be clickable and take the user to the player's profile.
* The Description should be clickable and take the user to the associated Winter League Request.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to filter the Winter League Requests
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "Requests" page has three filters available for Winter League Club users. 
* The "season" filter defaults to the current season. Only prior years are available. Changing the dropdown will refresh the widget to display the selected years' requests. 
* The second filter is a Team filter. The teams available will be all of the teams that are Winter League Affiliates for the current season. 
* The default Team selected will be the logged in user's team. 
* The last filter is the status filter, and is composed of hyperlinks. (set cursor:pointer;)
* The available statuses are : 
  - All 
  - Pending
  - In Negotiation
  - Contracted
  - Denied
  - Cancelled
  - Expired
* Note that Club users do NOT see "Submitted" as a status, but instead see "Pending" for all Requests with a Submitted or Pending status. 
* "Submitted" is a BOC only status. 
* The default is "All", but selecting one of the other statuses should reload the widget to display only the requests that have the selected status.

title: As a Winter League User I want to see a list of my Club's Requests for the current season in English
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Requests+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Within the Winter League Club's site, there is a "Requests" tab. 
* Clicking on the "Requests" tab will load the Requests widget per the provided Data Discovery. 
* The Requests will be sorted in reverse chronological order based on Request Date. 
* By default only Requests Created by the logged in Club are displayed. 
*Filters and action buttons are covered in follow up stories*

title: As a Winter League User I want to see a list of my Club's Requests for the current season in Spanish
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Requests+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Necessary+Spanish+Translations

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Within the Winter League Club's site, when viewing the site in Spanish there is a "Solicitudes" tab. 
* Clicking on the "Solicitudes" tab will load the Requests widget per the provided Data Discovery (Spanish translations provided) and wireframe. 
* The Requests will be sorted in reverse chronological order based on Request Date. 
* By default only Requests Created by the logged in Club are displayed. 
* All filters work as detailed in the English story.

title: As a Winter League user I want to be able to Cancel a request in Spanish
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen in Spanish, they see a dropdown menu next to their own Club's requests with a status of "Pending" or "In Negotiation". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Cancelar". 
* Selecting "Cancelar" will update the Request's status to "Cancelado".
* If the user is cancelling a request that has already been sent to ebis, then ebis needs to delete the associated Winter League Request.

title: As a Winter League User I want to be able to create a new Request in Spanish
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/New+Winter+League+Request+-+Data+Discovery

Spanish Translations:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Necessary+Spanish+Translations


Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the site in Spanish, Winter League Club Users see a "Nuevas Solicitudes" button on the Requests screen.
* Clicking "Nuevas Solicitudes" will open a pop up where the user can select an ebis player to create a new Request for. 
* The dropdown of players should be all current MLB Players (currently affiliated with an Org - do not include Released or FA players). 
* Selecting a player will populate the POS, MLB Org and DOB fields on the pop up. 
* The Club user should NOT be able to select which Winter League Club to create the request for. 
* The "Enviar" button should be available after a player has been selected.
* Clicking "Agregar Linea" should add an additional row to the Request form for the user to be able to submit multiple requests for the same Club at once. 
* If more than one row exists, there is a trash can icon associated with each row. 
* Clicking the trash can icon will remove the relevant row.
* Clicking "Enviar" should submit the request to the BOC and throw a blue success notification per the wireframe. (X Solicitudes Enviadas)
* The Request should appear in the appropriate Winter League Club's list of Requests, as well as the BOC's List of requests as "Pending".

title: As a Winter League user I want to be able to Cancel a request in English
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user with permission to edit Requests is viewing the Requests screen, they see a dropdown menu next to their own Club's requests with a status of "Pending" or "In Negotiation". 
* Clicking the dropdown will allow them to select "Cancel". 
* Selecting "Cancel" will update the Request's status to "Canceled".
* If the user is cancelling a request that has already been sent to ebis, then ebis needs to delete the associated Winter League Request.

title: As a Winter League User I want to be able to create a new Request in English
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the "Requests" widget Winter League Club Users see a "Create New" button.
* Clicking "Create New" will open a pop up where the user can select an ebis player to create a new Request for. 
* The dropdown of players should be all current MLB Players (currently affiliated with an Org - do not include Released or FA players). 
* Selecting a player will populate the POS, MLB Org and DOB fields on the pop up. 
* The Club user should NOT be able to select which Winter League Club to create the request for. 
* The "Submit to BOC" button should be available after a player and Winter League Club have been selected.
* Clicking "Add Row" should add an additional row to the Request form for the user to be able to submit multiple requests for the same Club at once. 
* If more than one row exists, there is a trash can icon associated with each row. 
* Clicking the trash can icon will remove the relevant row.
* Clicking "Submit to BOC" should submit the request to the BOC and throw a blue success notification per the wireframe.
* The Request should appear in the appropriate Winter League Club's list of Requests, as well as the BOC's List of requests as "Pending".

title: As a Winter League Club I want to see a countdown of the days I have left to move a request from In Negotiation to Contracted
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Request Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Acceptance Criteria: 
* For Requests that are in the "In Negotiation" status the, "Days Remaining" column should be populated with a countdown from 11 of the number of days since the Request was moved to the In Negotiation status. (In other words, the day the request was granted should read 11, the day after it should read 10, etc.). 
* No count should appear here for any other status for Winter League Club users. (unlike BOC)
* This should display properly whether the user is viewing the page in English or Spanish.

title: As a Winter League Club user, I want to see request updates by the BOC properly reflected in my Requests list
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Request is submitted on behalf of a WL Club, it appears for both the BOC and the relevant Winter League Clubs. 
* When a Request is moved to Canceled or Contracted, the update appears for both the BOC and the relevant Winter League Clubs.
* Winter League Clubs also see updates when a Request is Expired, Granted (moves to In Negotiation) or Denied in ebis.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be prevented from creating a Request for a player that has another Request currently in the In Negotiation status (English)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=errors_displayed_in_row  (general wireframe for displaying tables errors in a row)

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Request+-+Business+Rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "Submit Request" on the Create New Request modal, the system will check to see if any of the players included in the request have another Winter League Request in the "In Negotiation" status. 
* If a player is found to already have a request in that status, the system will display an error message in-line with the offending request(s) (see mockup). See Messages #2. 
* The error column will appear between the trashcan and player name
* None of the requests will be processed until each submitted request can pass all rule checks. 
* The user should have the opportunity to remove the offending request(s) and resubmit.

title: As a Major League Club user I want to see the Contracted comments on a Winter League Request
custom_steps:
Winter League Request Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Request+Data+Discovery

Wireframe:
https://vpqzii.axshare.com/#p=winter_league_request

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Winter League Request transaction form should be updated to include 2 new fields to display the Contracted comments and date. See wireframe and data discovery.

title: Winter League Club - Request List permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created for the Winter League Club Request List viewer role.
* A new LDAP is created for the Winter League Club Request List editor role. 
* Users without either LDAP do not see the "Requests" tab in the Winter League portal. 
* The LDAPs are added to the wiki.

title: As a Winter League user I want to see the blue successful save notifications translated when I am using the site in Spanish
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When saving changes to a Reserve List there is a blue notification that displays. 
  * In English this says: "Your changes have been saved successfully."
  * In Spanish this should say: "Sus cambios se han guardado exitosamente." 

* When submitting a new Winter League Request there is a blue notification that displays.
  * In English this says: "X Request Submitted" or "X Requests Submitted"
  * In Spanish this should say: "X solicitud sometida" or "X solicitudes sometidas"

* When canceling a Winter League Request there is a blue notification that displays.
  * In English this says "Request Cancelled". 
  * In Spanish this should say "Solicitud cancelada"

title: As a Winter League user I want to see an are you sure message when Canceling a request (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking 'Cancelar' on the Requests page the user is prompted to confirm that they wish to cancel the player's request. See Messages #13.
* If the user confirms, the request is cancelled. 
* If the user does not confirm, no action is taken.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be prevented from submitting a request for a player that already has a request pending for my Club
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club submits a request for a player, the system should check to see if the player already has a Pending or Submitted request for the creating Club. 
* This check should include if the player appears more than once in the Request list being currently submitted. 
* If a Pending or Submitted request for the player already exists for the creating Club, display an error. See Messages #17.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be prevented from submitting a request for a player that already has a request pending for my Club (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club submits a request for a player, the system should check to see if the player already has a Pending or Submitted request for the creating Club. 
* This check should include if the player appears more than once in the Request list being currently submitted. 
* If a Pending or Submitted request for the player already exists for the creating Club, display the error in Spanish if the user is submitting the request in Spanish. See Messages #17.

title: As a BOC user I want the Reserve List widget to be populated with the correct Clubs
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reserve+List+Population+Batch

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Reserve List Population" is a batch option under the "International" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "Reserve List Population" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters and the provided rules. 
* Any Reserve List created or updated as a result of this batch running should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be League, Club, Reserve List Created, Reserve List Archived. 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget. 
* A system date value will need to be added for the Winter League Portal Rollover date.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to add a player not in ebis to a reserve list
custom_steps:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Add+Unlisted+Player+-+Data+Discovery

Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=add_unlisted_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* In Edit Mode there is the option to Add Unlisted Player once the user has attempted to search for a player profile.
* Clicking "Add Unlisted Player" will launch a modal, per the provided wireframe. 
* The user must populate all required fields in order for the "Add Player" button to enable. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will cancel the addition and close the modal. 
* Clicking "Add Player" will add the player as entered into the system as a specific WLP player and will be available for future use. 
* The player and their information as entered on the modal will display in the selected List section. 
* The user should be able to use drag and drop to relocate the player to a new section. 
* The addition of the player to the Reserve List is not stored until the entire list is saved.

title: As a BOC user I want the system to determine whether or not possible duplicates appear on Reserve Lists
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a player is added to any Reserve List, the system should check to see if the player potentially exists on another Reserve List already. 
* This check should be done by comparing the player's First Name, Last Name and DOB to all other players currently on any reserve list (manually entered or associated with an ebis profile). 
* If an exact match on those three fields is found to be on more than one Reserve List, then their name should appear in the Possible Duplicates widget. 
* The player should appear in the widget once for each list he is found in. (In other words, if he is on three lists, he would appear 3 times.)
* A flag should appear next to the player on each Reserve List that a suspected match appears on. 
* If a player that has been identified as a possible duplicate is removed a Reserve List, the Possible Duplicates widget and the duplicate flag of the corresponding profiles should be updated accordingly. 
  - Ex: If Pat Jones1 is a match to Pat Jones2, both would appear in the widget and both would have flags indicating they were a possible duplicate in their Reserve Lists. If Pat Jones2 is deleted from his Reserve List, then both entries are removed from the Possible Duplicates widget and Pat Jones1 should no longer show as a possible duplicate on his reserve list.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if I attempt to remove an Import player that already has a request entered
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/WLP+-+Reserve+List+-+Business+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* Attempting to remove a player from a Reserve List that already has a non-Canceled Winter League Request entered for the same season as the reserve list (they can have a request for a prior season) will result in Error Message #8.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Import section of a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 10 players in the Import section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 10 players in the Import list, display error. See Messages #3.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Secondary section of a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 40 players in the Secondary section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 40 players in the Secondary list, display error. See Messages #5.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Primary section of a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 30 players in the Primary section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 30 players in the Primary list, display error. See Messages #4.

title: As a BOC user I want to generate an email of all Approved Reserve Lists to the Club Winter League Reserve List users in the email utility
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When "Release to Clubs" is clicked and the user confirms that they wish to submit, the system should check if emails are enabled by ensuring that "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
* If yes, then the system should generate an email to each of the email addresses listed in the e-mail utility under "Winter League Reserve Lists" that is checked off to receive emails, as long as the "BOC Enabled" or "Club Enabled" checkbox is also checked (depending on if the email is listed under BOC or Club). 
* The email will match the provided template. 
  - Subject: "20XX-20XX Winter League Reserve Lists"  (Ex: right now this would be 2018-2019 Winter League Reserve Lists)
  - Body: "Attached is the complete list of players placed on Winter League Reserve Lists for the 20XX-20XX Winter League Season. Please contact Giovanni Hernandez at giovanni.hernandez@mlb.com or Ismael Granadillo at ismael.granadillo@mlb.com with questions or concerns."
* The provided names and email addresses in the body of the email should be dynamic and able to be changed without a build.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the reserve list tables in alphabetical order by last name in view mode
custom_steps:
'AC:
- On page load or save the import, primary and secondary tables should display in alphabetical order by player's last name.

title: As a BOC user I want to export all Reserve Lists to excel
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Export all to Excel" button available on the Reserve List widget.
* Clicking "Export all to Excel" will generate an .xls file of all the players currently on a Reserve List.
* The available columns will be (in this order): 
 - Player First Name
 - Player Last Name
 - Date of Birth (MM/DD/YYYY)
 - Position
 - Throws
 - Major League Organization
 - Winter League
 - Winter League Club
 - Category
 - Duplicate
 - Comments
 - Ebis ID
* The population is every player that is on a Reserve List for the season being viewed (can be done for prior seasons). 
* The excel file should be organized with all Import players first, followed by all Primary, then Secondary. Within each Category players should be grouped by their team. 

*Sample attached*

title: As a BOC user I want to Release all Approved Reserve Lists to Clubs
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* While viewing the Reserve List widget, once all of the Reserve Lists for the current year have been marked "Approved", the "Release to Clubs" button should be available.
* Prior to all being marked Approved the button should either be hidden, or disabled. 
* Clicking this button will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to send the email. Messages #7. 
* If the user says ok, the system will generate an email to the users listed in the "Reserve List" portion of the email utility, the modal closes and the user is returned to the widget. Actual email generation covered in story #153837183.
* A blue notification should display that states "Reserve Lists Released to Clubs". 
* If the user cancels, then no action is taken, the modal closes and the user is returned to the widget. 
* The system needs to keep a record that the lists have been released on the backend (no front end indication is given for this).

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to remove a player from the list of possible duplicates
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Possible Duplicates widget, the BOC user should see a trash can for each line item. 
* Clicking the trash can for a player should remove all rows associated with that player from the widget.
* Ex: If Raul Fernandez appears three times, clicking the trash can icon on any one of his rows would remove all three of his rows at once. 
* When a player is removed from the Duplicates widget, the flag is also removed from the player's name on the corresponding Reserve List.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to view a list of players that are duplicated in Reserve Lists
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Possible+Duplicates+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking on the "Reserve Lists" tab will load the Possible Duplicates widget underneath the Reserve List widget per the provided Data Discovery and wireframe. 
* Population of the widget covered in a follow up story.

title: As a BOC user I want to Approve a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* While in view mode or edit mode, the BOC should see an "Approve" button on any un-approved Winter League Team's Reserve List. 
* Clicking "Approve" should update the Reserve List's status to "Approved".

title: As a BOC user I want to add a player to a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria: 
* While in edit mode, BOC users see a section at the top of the form that allows them to enter new players.
* Populating any value in the two required fields (First and Last) will enable the Search button. 
* Clicking Search will run a search for players that meet the entered criteria. 
  - The population of the search is ANY ebis player, regardless of status or age, and also any player that was previously entered in the Winter League Portal that was not tied to an ebis profile. 
* The system will return a list of players that meet the entered criteria, per the wireframe. 
* Checking off a player profile will enable the "Add" buttons available and the user will have the ability to add the selected player to the Import, Primary or Secondary lists this way. 
* The user will also have the ability to drag and drop a player into the desired list. 
* The addition of the player is not kept until the form as a whole is Saved. 
* Clicking "Save" should store the changes made. 

*Adding unlisted players is a follow up story*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to edit a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reserve+List+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing a Reserve List, the BOC sees an "Edit" button. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the Reserve List in edit mode per the wireframe. 
* In edit mode, the user will have the ability to remove players from the Reserve Lists by using the trash can. 
* In edit mode, the user will have the ability to edit the comments associated with a player by clicking on the comments bubble icon. 
* In edit mode, there will be a "Cancel" button and a "Save" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen is refreshed in View mode and none of their changes are kept (including changes made to comments). 
* Clicking "Save" will store all of the changes made to the screen, and any associated comments and a blue successful save notification will be thrown.(Rule checks completed in later stories)

title: As a user I want to be able to manage who receives the Approved Reserve List email via the email utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=email_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under the "Utilities" expandable subcategory under the email utility screen there is a section for the "Winter League Reserve Lists". 
* Users are able to add and remove email addresses for this, as well as enable or disable emails for the individual email addresses.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if a player I am adding is already in the reserve list I am editing
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Add Player" on the add unlisted player popup will verify that the selected player is not already present on the Reserve List being viewed.
* If the player is already present, then fire warning. See Messages #6. (Same check as for Possible Duplicates - First, Last and DOB)

title: BOC Reserve List permissions
custom_steps:
Wiki page: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS+2+Roles+to+LDAP+Mapping+and+creating+new+permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Reserve List viewer role.
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Reserve List editor role. 
* Users without the viewer or editor LDAP cannot open Reserve Lists. 
* Users without the editor LDAP do not see any buttons on the form other than "Close". 
* The relevant LDAPs are added to the wiki.

title: As a BOC user I want an excel file of all of the players currently on an Approved Reserve List to be attached to the email
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When "Release to Clubs" is clicked and an email is generated, there is an excel file attached to each email.
* The excel file should be the complete export of players included on every Approved Reserve List for the current season. 
* The available columns will be (in this order): 
 - Player First Name
 - Player Last Name
 - Date of Birth (MM/DD/YYYY)
 - Position
 - Throws
 - Major League Organization
 - Winter League
 - Winter League Club
 - Category
 - Ebis ID
* The sort will be on Last Name and then First Name. 
* The title of the file should be "20xx-20xx Master WL Reserve List".
* The header row of the export should have some formatting.

title: As BOC I want to be notified if the email of Reserve Lists fails to send to one or more of the email recipients
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* If one or more of the emails that the system attempts to generate does not get successfully sent to the list of recipients, then the system should generate a failure email to the email addresses that are listed as "Send Failure Notif" 
* Email should follow the template: 
 - Subject "Error sending Winter League Reserve List Emails"
 - Body "The system was unable to send the Winter League Reserve List email to the following recipients: " followed by a list of any email addresses that the system was unable to send the email to.

* Clubs can also not edit Approved Reserve Lists.
* They do not see an Edit button on any other Club's reserve list.
* If the current date is past the Reserve List Deadline system date, no edit button is displayed for these users. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the Reserve List in edit mode, per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
* In edit mode, the user will have the ability to use drag and drop to drag players from section to section. 
* In edit mode, the user will have the ability to remove players from the Reserve Lists by using the trash can. 
* In edit mode, there will be a "Cancel" button and a "Save" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen is refreshed in View mode and none of their changes are kept (including changes made to comments). 
* Clicking "Save" will store all of the changes made to the screen, and any associated comments. (Rule checks completed in later stories)

  - The population of the search is ANY ebis player, regardless of status or age, and also any player that was previously entered in the Winter League Portal that was not tied to an ebis profile.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if a player I am adding is already in the reserve list I am editing (English)
custom_steps:

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Add Player" will verify that the selected player is not already present on the Reserve List being viewed.
* If the player is already present, then fire warning. See Messages #6.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if a player I am adding is already in the reserve list I am editing (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Add to Import" "Add to Primary" or "Add to Secondary" will verify that the selected player is not already present on the Reserve List being viewed.
* If the player is already present, then fire warning. See Messages #6.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Import section of a Reserve List (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 10 players in the Import section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 10 players in the Import list, display error. See Messages #3.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Primary section of a Reserve List (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 30 players in the Primary section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 30 players in the Primary list, display error. See Messages #4.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if there are too many players in the Secondary section of a Reserve List (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there are not more than 40 players in the Secondary section of the Reserve List. 
* If there are more than 40 players in the Secondary list, display error. See Messages #5.

title: As a Club user I want to see the reserve list tables in alphabetical order by last name in view mode
custom_steps:
'AC:
- On page load or save the import, primary and secondary tables should display in alphabetical order by player's last name.

title: As a Winter League User I want to see the Reserve List widget in English
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reserve+List+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a "Reserve Lists" tab when signed in as a Winter League club user. 
* Clicking on the "Reserve Lists" tab will load the Reserve List widget per the provided Data Discovery.

title: As a Major League Club user I want to be able to view a Reserve List
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking on a Reserve List as a Major League Club user loads the Reserve List per the provided wireframe EXCEPT they do not see the Comments.
* MLB Club users are only able to view/open Reserve Lists that have been Released to All Clubs.

title: As a Major League Club user I want to be able to export all Reserve Lists
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* MLB  Club users see an "Export All To Excel" button on their Reserve List widget. 
* Clicking this button will download an excel file to the user's computer with every player that is included in a Reserve List that has been Released to the Club for the season currently being viewed in the Reserve List widget. 
* The excel export should match that which is provided via the email utility as per #156213727.

title: As a Major League Club user I want to be able to view the Reserve List widget
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=reserve_list_widget_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Major League Clubs see a WLP - Reserve Lists tab under the International Dashboard if they have the proper permissions. 
* Navigating to the Reserve List Tab will display the Reserve List widget per the provided wireframe. 
* MLB Clubs only see Reserve Lists in the widget that have been Released to Clubs.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the WLP User Accounts Page
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "System" there is a WLP Users tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* The options available under League will be: 
  - Venezuelan Winter League
  - Puerto Rican Winter League
  - Mexican Winter League
  - Dominican Winter League
  - League Presidents
  - Unassigned
* The options available under "Team" will depend on the League selected. 
* Each Affiliate associated with a Team will appear as an option, regardless of if the affiliate is currently active or not. 
* The "User" dropdown default will be "All" 
* When User is set to All there is also a "Role" dropdown available. 
* The Role dropdown should default to All. 
* When User is set to a value other than "All" the Role dropdown should no longer be available. 
* There is a "View" button available on the screen.

title: As a BOC user I want to load the permissions for a Team of users
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected League and Team. 
* BOC users are able to pick a specific League, Team and leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Team's user ids per the wireframe (scroll to 2nd snapshot on the wire).

title: As a BOC user I want to edit the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a user id has been loaded in the utility, there is an "Edit" button on the page. 
* Clicking "Edit" will place the page in edit mode, replacing the Edit button with a Save button and a Cancel button. 
* Clicking the Cancel button will ask the user to confirm that they are OK losing changes, and if the user confirms, reload the page in view mode with no changes made to the selected user id. 
* While in Edit mode, there is a dropdown that the user can use to select a new Role to add to the userid being edited. 
* Selecting a Role from the dropdown will add the Role to the screen. 
* In edit mode the user will also see trash cans associated with each Role the user has, and be able to remove the user from any of its current roles using the trash cans. 
* No changes are maintained until the user clicks "Save". 
* Clicking "Save" reloads the page in View mode, with the changes made to the user id's account maintained. 
* If a role has been added more than once to the same userID, do not add it for a second time (control duplicate roles this way).

title: WLP User Accounts - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a new LDAP created to control the visibility of the WLP User Accounts page. 
* There is a new LDAP created to control the edit capabilities of the WLP User Accounts page to assign roles. 
* There is a new LDAP created to control the edit capabilities of the WLP User Accounts page to assign groups within the roles. 
* If the user does not have either LDAP, they do not see the tab as an option on the Utilities dashboard and they are unable to navigate to the tab. 
* The permissions wiki is updated appropriately.

title: As a user I want to see the correct International dashboard for my permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:

* Only those users with the Winter League Request viewers or editors role should see the WLP - Requests tab on the WLP Top Nav
* Only those users with the Winter League Reserve List widget viewers role should see the WLP - Reserve List tab on the WLP Top Nav

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to choose whether to view the homepage in English or Spanish
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria: 
* After logging into the system, there is an "English" and an "Espaol" hyperlink at the top of the page, see wireframe for location. 
* The language currently being used is greyed out and not clickable.
* When viewing the site in English, clicking on "Espaol" will reload the page in Spanish. The system will need to maintain this selection as the user navigates from tab to tab and form to form. 
* When viewing the site in Spanish, clicking on "English" will reload the page in English. The system will need to maintain this selection as the user navigates from tab to tab and form to form. 

Tab names in Spanish: 
 - Comunicacin del Club (Club Communication)
 - Lista PIEF (PIEF List)
 - Lista de Reserva (Reserve List)
 - Solicitudes (Requests)

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to Sign Out of the system
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Sign Out" link at the top right corner of the page per the wireframe. 
* If viewing the page in Spanish this says "Finalizar Sesin", in English it says "Sign Out". 
* Clicking "Sign Out" or "Finalizar Sesin"  will log the user out of the winter league portal, and take them back to the login page.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to sign in to the Winter League Portal
custom_steps:
Mockups: 
When this story gets assigned please reach out for full access to the Zeplin project

Login https://scene.zeplin.io/project/5a5e3ea40bc236e05ff04e50/screen/5a5e3eccb14a7a27589af18b

UI
https://scene.zeplin.io/project/5a5e3ea40bc236e05ff04e50/screen/5a60f33658a7e256c82b7b4a

Mobile UI
https://scene.zeplin.io/project/5a5e3ea40bc236e05ff04e50/screen/5a621cd23ffff38ed26de121
https://scene.zeplin.io/project/5a5e3ea40bc236e05ff04e50/screen/5a621cd1f7420f59255872d1

The only new styling that needs to be done within the UI is the new top nav and the club header (Toros del Este in the mockup).  All other styling should be pulled in from ebis global styles (forms, widgets, notifications, modals, etc.)

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A user is able to enter a valid username and password on the Winter League Portal site and click "Login". 
* The system will verify the user's credentials, and assuming they are valid, will log the user into the site and take them to the homepage. 
* This story will need to include the UI as well as whatever setup is needed to establish username/passwords that allow entry to the WLP site.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want the system to be able to tell which Club I am affiliated with
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=club_comm_widget_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Winter League Club users can be assigned a role (probably an LDAP but up to dev to determine best solution) to signify which Winter League Club they belong to. 
* These LDAPs will need to correspond with the Affiliates added so need to be able to somehow be added outside of builds. (We can't require a new build to add a Club.)
* When a Winter League Club user logs in to the system, they will see their Club logo that indicates which Club the system has identified them with (from the affiliate profile). 
* If the user is not affiliated with a specific Club (they are unassigned), they are able to login and do not see a logo.

title: As a Winter League Club I want to be able to view the PIEF List in Spanish
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/PIEF+List+-+WPL+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* When viewing the Winter League Portal in Spanish, there is a Lista PIEF tab available per the wireframe. 
* Clicking on the PIEF List tab will load the PIEF List in Spanish, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
* Loading the tab will load the current season's PIEF Lists by default. 
* The user will have the ability to view prior years by changing the "season" filter. 
* Only "Approved" players appear in the list. 
* The content within the PIEF List is NOT translated - only the column headers and the widget title

title: As a Winter League user I want to see an are you sure message when Canceling a request (English)
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking 'Cancel' on the Requests page the user is prompted to confirm that they wish to cancel the player's request. See Messages #13.
* If the user confirms, the request is cancelled. 
* If the user does not confirm, no action is taken.

title: As a user I want to be directed to the proper Portal link if I click the Sign Up link on the WLP login page
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Clicking "Sign Up" on the winterleagues login page should open a new tab/window for the user that navigates them to 
https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationForm/?GROUP=WinterLeagues

title: As a user I want to be directed to the proper Portal link if I click the Forgot Password link on the WLP login page
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Clicking "Forgot Password" on the winterleagues login page should open a new tab/window for the user that navigates them to 
https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationPassword/

title: As a user I want to see an error message if I enter invalid credentials on the WLP login page
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Entering invalid credentials (an invalid username or password) and clicking Log In should trigger an error message. See Messages #14.

title: As a Winter League user I want to be able to see the Reserve List and Requests even if I am not affiliated with a Club
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user logs into the Winter League Portal site that appears in the WLP Users page as "Unassigned" but has Viewer access to Reserve Lists and Requests, they should be able to load those pages.
* The Requests can just default to the first Club in the list. 
* The Reserve List widget view should default to all Leagues/Clubs for the current year.

title: As a Winter League Club I only want to be able to view the PIEF List if it has been Sent to Clubs (Send Lists to BOC action)
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/PIEF+List+-+WPL+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* Winter League Club users will only be able to view the PIEF Lists that have been finalized and officially published. This should be driven by the "Send Lists to BOC" action.  
* Once that has been done for the PIEF Lists, the year should be available for the WL Clubs as detailed in story #154103634 and #155455405. 
* Prior to the list being sent to BOC, it should not be available. All prior years should be available.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Winter League Performance Report
custom_steps:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Prompts

Audience/Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Audience+-+Security+-+Frequency

View Story: #157500263

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Winter League Performance Report" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Pro Player Management". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with. 
* Please note the details around formatting provided at the top of the Report Details document, and the fact that the prompts allowed will vary based on the user type. 

*For QA* - This report needs to be compared with the current winter league portal version of the report. We are not building out all of the prompts at this time so we will need to discuss the best way to test/compare. We are only testing this for MLB Club/BOC users for this release.
